bow: needing advice on bad diaper rashes my year old has had diaper rash for now month last week we saw his doctor and she said it had yeast on it and gave us nystatin cream and ve been putting it on since we got it on the 13th it not getting any better and today it bleeding from him scratching it non stop we re in minnesota so it cold so always have pants on him he rubs over it and keep catching him and stopping it ve been giving him baths only every days due to it being so dry here im at loss right now what to due cus the advice got from my parents were to let him run around naked but he ll just scratch at it and there already open bleeding cracks and do want to get it any worse if this is the right sub sorry does any one have advice or tried or true ways to get rid of it hate seeing my child in pain your best bet is to let it dry out in the air then apply the cream is there any way you can keep his hands occupied maybe duct tape mittens to his sleeves lol kidding not kidding seriously though it got to dry out yeast bacteria thrive in wet environment so bare bum is your best shot know it so much easier to say than do when your one year old is super mobile and wiggly my heart goes out to you good luck mama had this problem with my lo when she was having problems pooping she would get really bad itchy and sometimes bleedy rashes she was toilet trained at the time but we kept her out of nappies and let her run free we death with the mess that came with it but heck at least it was touching her rash when she was having accidents and it did help quite bit with drying it out on cold days we put really baggy light pj pants so it would be touching her legs also forgot to mention that the only time we put cream on her was at night time when we had to put her in nappy and we used an oil based cream to keep wetness off it that was also antibacterial it called bepanthan you can pick it up here in ireland in shops and chemists not too sure where they sell it though have you tried nivea the thick cream in the blue tin is our go to for tough rashes do you use disposable diapers because when my son got rashy we go up size while the diaper cream did it job and just change him every hour the bigger diapers offer more room so the diaper is actually pressed on his buns they re more absorbant so he ll stay more dry and it helps eliminate messes that you get from going naked once his buns are open wounds try using bag balm on him at night once you re done with the nystatin it got lanolin in it so it ll really help with the dryness my son gets dry skin all over so lather him up after baths he smells like barnyard from the lanolin but it better than him bleeding from scratching so much yes do he in size which fits perfect for him can try the next size up it right in the creases of his thighs like his balls and around that area the diaper rash so perfect area for him to scratch at sadly no have tried walmart brand of diaper rash extra strength desitin and baby powder before we got prescription cream ugh that awful poor bub and poor you think naked time would be best then my son gets rashy at the bottom of his buns like where you sit so it not bad spot could you put gloves on him to reduce his ability to scratch our doc prescribed concoction that cleared up our bad diaper rash overnight she said equal parts nystatin hydrocortisone cream and zinc oxide mix it in with little maalox to get creamy consistency works like charm my son had bad yeast rash and the nystatin didn seem to help much finally we started using tons and tons of desitin max strength instead and it cleared up pretty fast we also did lots of naked time and stopped washing him with soap just used water at his nightly baths we seriously covered him in thick thick layers of desitin ll have to try that tonight thank you oh this sounds so tough so sorry my daughter got strep on her butt apparently it lives in your system and just got out of control in her case and we gave her baking soda baths to help it cleared it up really well you put cup of baking soda into the bath just water nothing else and it really helped it was few years ago but want to say it helped immediately and cleared up in baths with no antibiotics naked time fresh air heals it quickly you hast have to pay attention to accidents and have towels on hand while diaper cream usually worked for us the one really bad persistent time we had to go completely different route we used only water wipes dried off the area and then coated in baby powder basically keep the area as dry as possible if you re uncomfortable with talc baby powder they make cornstarch ones now also yay for minnesota use blow dryer to make sure my kids butt is really dry before put diaper on instead of doing naked time frequent diaper changes every one to two hours load up on the cream this is his first diaper rash he got it overnight when he started teething my grandma said it due from him teething but his doctor said that not true it just old wives tales have baby powder on there right now and ve been dabbing at the rashy area feel so bad cus that has to hurt so bad it so red triple paste cream is my go to don do baby powder the cornstarch in it can feed the yeast we did nystatin covered by extra strength desitin until the weepy spots cleared up then just nystatin have you tried switching to sensitive skin wipes we also only use wipes for poop not just pee oh crap just put some on him to help dry everything out we use fragrance free wipes but was planning on buying those water wipes tonight can you get him underwear to wear for awhile underwear and pants would allow more air in but he have harder time getting to skin or overalls so he ca reach diem the pants cloth diapers might even be good solution you might want to try reintroducing the nightly bath my son has horrible eczema and his dermatologist said we need to give him quick bath every night and then moisturize within mins to lock in the moisture maybe that would help we ve had diaper rash with yeast before too and desitin really helped we use cream called inotyol he had really bad bleeding diaper rash this stuff cleared it up pretty much overnight contains ichthammol zinc oxide titanium dioxide and lanolin it magic have you tried lotrimin jock itch cream sometimes it works for us when nystatin doesn no have ll have to get it tonight thank you you can also add an emolliant to the bath when kiera skin gets dry we use one from oilatum it does make the bath not eye ball friendly so maybe keep the splashing to minimum this is what we use for yeast diaper rashes clotrimazole cream on the area twice day no diaper cream or anything else we use unscented wipes kirkland costco brand and huggies diapers the but cream has 40 zinc extra strength formula just try to pat dry with burp cloth really well thin layer of hydrocortisone 2x day is what works for us do not use for more than week dont know if this will help at all but we use earth mama angel baby bottom balm and it has helped with rashes quite bit what helped with *my* kids were nightly baths and anti monkey butt diaper cream we used sensitive wipes but the act of washing their bottoms even with just water seemed to really do the trick my daughter had the same issue and it turns out that it was eczema on her booty there was small yeast infection that knocked out with anti fungal meant for athletes foot cleared the eczema with thin layer of organic coconut oil then layer of petroleum jelly the jelly will help heal the skin good luck mom hope your little one feels better yes this stuff is the only thing that worked for my kiddo rashes calmoseptine it costs about 10 at most pharmacies and they keep it behind the counter you can also order it on amazon this stuff is pink magic we use it in the nicu work in and my pediatrician recommended it when my son had bloody rash it cleared it up quickly and has helped prevent future rashes use it on my newborn daughter too as preventative if your lo has bloody or oozing rash in the future crush maalox mix into 1:1 neosporin and calmoseptine this will help neutralize the stomach acid in poop prevent infection and the menthol in calmoseptine cools the burning from the rash hope this helps your little one my pediatrician recommended instead of using wipes to just dunk our daughter hind end in warm water then pat dry with towel then coat with aquaphor or petroleum jelly basically you want barrier between the skin and the diaper she was cracked skin bleeding oozing sores all over her genitals this recommendation was after we saw an urgent care doc and they prescribed nystatin etc and it toally worked now when she starts to get red we throw on little cornstarch and slather her up with petroleum jelly ridiculously cheap and it works don worry about the cornstarch if it not actually yeast diaper rash the cornstarch will help and if the nystatin isn working chances are it not yeast diaper rash corn starch helped dry out bad diaper rash and allowed the medicine to work without creating moist environment plus it does hurt the baby at all baby powder and other things had chemicals that would make my son scream sometimes try to alternate between the diaper rash cream and vaseline every diaper change that way they get the medicine but the vaseline moisturize it hope it helps would cornstarch help to dry it out we have it in new zealand this he needs as much naked time as you can give him it tough but it ll work it wo hurt it as far as know use baking soda in the bath water when rashes are bad some naked time might help too im also in mn so know that with the cold that is not always practical aquaphor is my go to cream which helps heal the sores it also works as barrier and you can use it on other dry skin on the body for little one and yourself triple paste af is the antifungal kind that worked for us also motherlove diaper cream it was hard battle and nystatin did nothing for us you can also just use spray bottle with just water and wipe with like hand towel or we use cloth style paper towels dampened with mixture of about cups water teaspoon or so of baby wash and couple tablespoons of coconut oil it seems to be much gentler on his skin second the baking soda baths it wasn cure for us but they provided instant relief from the discomfort never encountered that type of rash but we tend to bump up the diaper size when the rashes start she generally size too big according to the weights the packages suggest just throwing paint at the wall so you have few things to try hope you find something that helps your lo sounds terrible this make sure it has zinc oxide for the diaper rash otherwise it wo do anything and creams ending in zole are antifungal and will kill the yeast it does sound the best but athlete foot cream works great on my baby air time is also really good two to three hours day should help same my mom recommended this and it works really really well the zinc oxide is meant to be barrier for moisture so if you get rid of excess moisture it does its job much better cornstarch is actually an excellent food source for yeast so you re better off not using it keeping it clean and dry is going to be better also use combination of hydrocortisone cream and clotrimazole cream to calm the rash and kill the yeast we had to do this for our daughter you actually want to bathe your baby daily to help prevent infection but you ll want to completely dry them off before reapply diaper cream try an elimination diet in case of an allergy typically diary is the biggest culprit but diaper rashes when you ve been providing care should be this bad is your lo at daycare if yes are you sure they are changing his diaper frequently yup if the nystatin doesn work clotrimazol is you go to my daughter is so yeast prone her diapers smell like bread sometimes you can get it from amazon for significant savings literally the answer is sunlight find sunny window if it too cold outside put baby on his tummy on your lap and face his bum to he sun spread his cheeks tiny bit to let the sunlight get to all the rash do this for 10 minutes straight then you can apply aquaphor or coconut oil or breast milk or whatever you are using then in an hour or do the sunlight thing again do this as many times as you can in day three times day was probably my max it seriously works good luck we were told to use monistat for yeast when my daughter had it and for any really bad spots we use calmoseptine it super thick and works very quickly you just have to make sure the skin is dry first or it wo stick desitin always made her rashes worse but calmoseptine clears it right up my mom swears by dr bordeuxs butt paste it works really well and will admit have used it as an adult after long day at six flags this bottom balm is the only one that has ever helped mine too salt water bath my mother is nurse and swore by it for me and reccomended it it does not burn it is actually soothing keep giant box in the bathroom and bust it out when my sons gets really bad let him soak and play in there for several minutes make sure to completely dry him off before applying creams and diaper it helps dry it out and sooth the skin and it has minor antiseptic properties sore throat gargle salt water same thing for sore butt oh that genius definitely have put him in right after bm we wipe most of the solid stuff off first of course this is going to sound weird but your answer is boiled rags snippets of cloth from old sheets bedding or clothes diapers you boil the hell out of them and then place the cold small snippets on his bum you need to replace them frequently during the day this is basically like type of wound dressing and has been used successfully in my country for hundreds of years you can google the concept in my language to read more kogtvandsklude after my second born he had yeast infection and got thrush highly recommend genitian violet it old school but thrush and yeast infection was gone within days just google it and you should be able to get the dilution instructions got mine from amazon good luck my daughter had
